Key Match Events: Norman Powell scored 11 points in the second quarter to help the Clippers build a 51-45 halftime lead.
Los Angeles took a 78-73 lead into the fourth quarter and began the period with a 16-5 run.
The Kings cut a 16-point fourth-quarter deficit to four with under three minutes to play.
Powell and Amir Coffey hit consecutive 3-pointers to push the lead back to double digits.
Post-Match Reflections: Clippers: Los Angeles, looking to hold down the fort until star Kawhi Leonard returns from right knee inflammation, is above.500 for the first time this season after a 2-4 start.
Kings: The Kings were 3 of 26 from 3-point range and made just one 3 in the second half. The Kings are in the bottom five in the NBA in 3-point shooting, entering the game at a 32.5% clip.
